other_tests.findings: Patients were started on intravenous vancomycin after cultures were obtained.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Patients improved clinically with reduced signs of infection, white blood cell counts trended to normal.

other_tests.findings: Turbid periprosthetic fluid collection ranging from slightly turbid to cloudy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequent drainage and lavage led to resolution of symptoms.

other_tests.findings: Markedly thickened capsule and significant periprosthetic fluid.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Patients reported subjective improvement and resolution of erythema.

other_tests.findings: Replacement of infected prostheses with new implants.
other_tests.changes_over_time: All patients remained intact with no signs of re-infection at follow-up.

other_tests.findings: Demonstrated presence and nature of periprosthetic fluid collections.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Assisted in identifying collections for drainage which improved clinical outcomes.

other_tests.findings: Demonstrated inflammatory changes and culture positive for Staphylococcus epidermidis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No growth of organisms in seroma fluid indicated effective management of infection.
